result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristen Nicole Samierad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kristen Nicole Samierad in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 1:10 a.m.  Complaint has been served.  Def waives reading and waives right to prelim.  Court accepts waiver.  Recess at 1:18 p.m.  1:25 p.m. BOR:  DA presents DEJ to court.  Calls cases 16CF39, 17CF4, 16CF52.  Per atty Hoffmann, no PLQ filed but has discussed with def and understands DEJ.  Court and attorneys have side bar discussion.  After discussion, information is filed and court proceeds to ARGN.  Atty Hoffmann reviews Info.  Mirrors complaint, waives reading and stands mute.  NG to be entered in 17CF4.  Defense asking court to sign DEJ.  Court grants up to 60 days for def to report for jail sentence.  Discussion held re costs and DNA sample/surcharge.  Only one set of costs/sample/surcharge.  Atty Hoffmann addresses court:  on 16CF39, def pleads NC to Count 1 & 2.  On 16CF52, def pleads to amended county of Misd.  Bailjumping.  Court accepts pleas.  Adjourned at 1:35 p.m.  Per judge after court, def is entitled to Good Time and Huber.  klr

Defendant Kristen Nicole Samierad in court, lodged, with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann appearing via phone means.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Karla Sommer, court reporter.   Case called at 10:53 a.m.  DA calls cases, gives court background re possible bond violation.  Asks for $1,000 cash bond to be set.  Def addresses court.  Attorney Hoffmann addresses court.  Suggest possible additional bond.  DA  renews request to $500 cash.  Court sets additional bond of $1,000 signature with same as previous conditions.  To be scheduled for February 9th at 1:00 p.m. Adj. 11:00 a.m.  klr
THIS BOND IS IN ADDITION TO FIRST BOND AND COVERS 16CF39, 16CF52 AND POSSIBLE NEW CASE.  NO ALCOHOL, NO TAVERNS, NO LIQUOR STORES, NO CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 9, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 10:20 a.m.  Defendant Kristen Nicole Samierad in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Matthew J. Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case, cites appearances.  Time for arraignment.  Information has been filed in both cases.  Clerk provides copy of Info for def counse.  Def atty recieved infos, identical to complaint, waives reading and stands mute on all counts.  Court directs clerk to enter NG plea.  Both cases are to be scheduled for PLEAS.  Bond to continue per court.  Adj. 10:25 klr
Pre-trial conference on January 17, 2017 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Kristen Nicole Samierad in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases 16CF39 and 16CF52.  In 16CF39, case set for PLEAS.  In 16CF52, initial appearance.  Parties proceed with initial appearance.  Attorney Hoffmann acknowledges rct of complaint, def understands complaint, waives reading and waives right to prelim.  Court questions def re waiver.  Def agrees with atty, court grants waiver.  Bond to continue.  klr

Def appears in person, in custody.  Frederick j Schellgell appears for the State of Wisconsin.  16CF39 is underlying case.  Possible charges of Bail jumpint.  Requests cash bond.  Court questions def re employment.  Address provided to court.  Def is a veteran.  Vic witness to help get services close to Iron Mtn.  Omnibus bond per court, this case is added to other bond.  No new bond needs to be prepared per court.  DA reiterates bond.  klr
